SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi

Class DataSourceDef

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.Resource
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.DataSourceDef
All Implemented Interfaces:
Wrapper, CommonDataSource, DataSource
public final class DataSourceDef extends Resource implements DataSource
JDBC DataSource for a web application. This proxies the DriverManager, and provides simple connection pooling facilities.
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • DataSourceDef

      public DataSourceDef()

  • Method Details

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description)
      Sets a description of this data source. Corresponds to the description element in the deployment descriptor.
      Parameters:
      description - a textual description of this data source
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the JNDI name by which this data source will be registered. Corresponds to the name element in the deployment descriptor.

      The name must be a valid JNDI name, typically in the form java:comp/env/jdbc/MyDataSource.

      Parameters:
      name - the JNDI name for this data source
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setClassName

      public void setClassName(String className)
      Sets the fully-qualified class name of the JDBC driver. Corresponds to the class-name element in the deployment descriptor.

      This should be the class name of the Driver implementation provided by the JDBC driver vendor.

      Parameters:
      className - the JDBC driver class name
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setServerName

      public void setServerName(String serverName)
      Sets the database server name. Corresponds to the server-name element in the deployment descriptor.

      The server name is used to construct the JDBC URL when url is not specified.

      Parameters:
      serverName - the database server hostname or IP address
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setPortNumber

      public void setPortNumber(int portNumber)
      Sets the port number where the database server is listening. Corresponds to the port-number element in the deployment descriptor.

      The port number is used to construct the JDBC URL when url is not specified. A value of -1 indicates the default port for the database.

      Parameters:
      portNumber - the database server port number, or -1 for the default
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setDatabaseName

      public void setDatabaseName(String databaseName)
      Sets the name of the database. Corresponds to the database-name element in the deployment descriptor.

      The database name is used to construct the JDBC URL when url is not specified.

      Parameters:
      databaseName - the database name
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setUser

      public void setUser(String user)
      Sets the database user name for authentication. Corresponds to the user element in the deployment descriptor.
      Parameters:
      user - the database user name
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setPassword

      public void setPassword(String password)
      Sets the database password for authentication. Corresponds to the password element in the deployment descriptor.
      Parameters:
      password - the database password
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setUrl

      public void setUrl(String url)
      Sets the JDBC connection URL. Corresponds to the url element in the deployment descriptor.

      This is an alternative to specifying server-name, port-number, and database-name separately. If specified, this URL takes precedence.

      Parameters:
      url - the full JDBC connection URL
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setIsolationLevel

      public void setIsolationLevel(int isolationLevel)
      Sets the isolation level for connections. Corresponds to the isolation-level element in the deployment descriptor.

      Valid values are the constants defined in Connection: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE, or TRANSACTION_NONE.

      Parameters:
      isolationLevel - the transaction isolation level
      See Also:
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setInitialPoolSize

      public void setInitialPoolSize(int initialPoolSize)
      Sets the initial number of connections in the pool. Corresponds to the initial-pool-size element in the deployment descriptor.

      This many connections will be created when the data source is initialized.

      Parameters:
      initialPoolSize - the initial number of pooled connections
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setMaxPoolSize

      public void setMaxPoolSize(int maxPoolSize)
      Sets the maximum number of connections in the pool. Corresponds to the max-pool-size element in the deployment descriptor.

      The pool will not grow beyond this size. Additional connection requests will block until a connection becomes available.

      Parameters:
      maxPoolSize - the maximum number of pooled connections
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setMinPoolSize

      public void setMinPoolSize(int minPoolSize)
      Sets the minimum number of connections in the pool. Corresponds to the min-pool-size element in the deployment descriptor.

      The pool will maintain at least this many connections, even when idle.

      Parameters:
      minPoolSize - the minimum number of pooled connections
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setMaxIdleTime

      public void setMaxIdleTime(int maxIdleTime)
      Sets the maximum time a connection can remain idle in the pool. Corresponds to the max-idle-time element in the deployment descriptor.

      Connections idle longer than this time will be closed and removed from the pool. A value of 0 means no timeout.

      Parameters:
      maxIdleTime - the maximum idle time in seconds, or 0 for no timeout
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setMaxStatements

      public void setMaxStatements(int maxStatements)
      Sets the maximum number of statements to be cached. Corresponds to the max-statements element in the deployment descriptor.

      This controls the size of the prepared statement cache maintained by the pool.

      Parameters:
      maxStatements - the maximum number of cached statements
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • setTransactionIsolation

      public void setTransactionIsolation(int transactionIsolation)
      Sets the default transaction isolation level for new connections. Corresponds to the transaction-isolation element in the deployment descriptor.

      Valid values are the constants defined in Connection: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE, or TRANSACTION_NONE.

      Parameters:
      transactionIsolation - the default transaction isolation level
      See Also:
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ
      • Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.4: DataSource

    • init

      public void init() throws javax.servlet.ServletException
      Initializes the data source, validating pool size settings and loading the JDBC driver class. Connection pools are created lazily on first use via getConnection().
      Overrides:
      init in class Resource
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
